abstract: Federal Communications Commission officials say approval has been given to Telcordia, New Jersey subsidiary of Ericsson, for operating national system that tracks and routes wireless calls and texts; contract is worth up to billion dollars over seven years.
lead_paragraph: Major wireless carriers pushed for Telcordia because of the cost savings, but some intelligence officials have raised national security concerns.

headline.main: F.C.C. Backs Swedish Company to Run American Phone Routing System
headline.print_headline: Swedish Group to Oversee American Phone Routing

snippet: Major wireless carriers pushed for Telcordia because of the cost savings, but some intelligence officials have raised national security concerns....
